# Scale: Harmonic in C (Mode: Romanian)

The Harmonic scale in C, also known as the Romanian mode, is a captivating melodic scale that sets a unique mood in music. By starting on the note of C, this scale creates an exotic and mysterious sound that can add depth and emotion to compositions.

## Notes and Intervals

The Harmonic scale in C consists of the following notes and intervals:
- C (root)
- D
- E-flat
- F#
- G
- A
- B

The intervals in this scale are: whole step, half step, minor third, augmented second, perfect fourth, perfect fifth, and minor sixth.

## Genre and Musical Flavor

The Harmonic scale in C, often used in Eastern European and Middle Eastern music, brings a rich and exotic flavor to compositions. It is frequently employed in folk, classical, and world music genres to evoke a sense of mystery, intrigue, and cultural authenticity.

This scale can transport listeners to distant lands and evoke feelings of nostalgia and adventure. Its unique intervals and harmonic qualities make it stand out in musical arrangements, offering a palette of melodies that are both emotive and enchanting.
